meanings.definition: To join together by intertwining yarn or thread
meanings.sent1: I will knit a scarf for my friend.
meanings.sent2: She likes to knit sweaters for her family.
meanings.sent3: The spider decided to knit a web in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like yarn, knitting them together.
meanings.sent5: The grandmother's hands moved swiftly as she knit a blanket.

meanings.definition: To form a fabric by interlocking loops of yarn
meanings.sent1: My grandma taught me how to knit a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent2: The machine can knit a whole sweater in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to knit a hammock out of yarn.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to knit a blanket of darkness over the sky.
meanings.sent5: The waves knit a pattern of foam on the shore.

meanings.definition: To bring together closely; unite closely
meanings.sent1: The community came together to knit blankets for the homeless.
meanings.sent2: Their shared love for music knit them into a tight-knit group.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to knit unusual ingredients into a new dish.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood knit them together like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The vines seemed to knit the garden into a lush tapestry.
